introduction: In the middle of the Meiji era (1886), Rogin, a Japanese painter travels with a passion to paint a great beauty. He searches for the highest-quality of natural pigments and arrives at a mountain village. Accidentally, he saves a middle-aged man. The man carries a backpack and introduces himself as Shioya (a salt merchant) . He tells Rogin about his past that deep in the mountain, he met the most beautiful woman he had never seen and fell in love with her. Her name was Toki. They had a non-human shaped baby, and one day, Toki disappeared in a river. Ever since then, Shioya has been looking for her...This pilot film is an introduction to the feature film "The Water Sprite".
